Introduction

This section will mainly focus on future goals, skills and plans related to software development. The main focus will be talking about future career plans but as well as any future plans learning about web development. My experience working in digitera has taught me a lot about computer science but has also made me think about a career in computer science.

Future Projects

With my newfound web development skills I want to pursue new projects as I found developign my DJ event planner enjoyable. My plan with these projects is to learn more about different backend and frontend web frameworks. Frameworks I am intrested in learning about include React, Node.js and Vue.js., I also want to learn more about database management, responsive design and real time databases. Not only will these projects improve my skills in web development, they will also help me with future job positions. Some possible projects are:

Portfolio Website

A simple web application that allows users to view my projects, skills, and contact information. Users can navigate through different sections like About Me, Projects, and Contact, with a responsive design that adapts to various screen sizes.

Technologies to Use:

  • Frontend: Tailwind CSS, React JS

Learning Opportunities:

  • Creating interactive frontend designs with react.
  • Learn more about java script for future framework designs

Personal Finance Tracker

A web application that allows users to track their income, expenses, and savings goals. Users can categorize transactions, generate monthly reports, and set budgets for specific categories like groceries or entertainment.

Technologies to Use:

  • Backend: Laravel (for handling user data, transaction management, and report generation).
  • Frontend: Tailwind CSS (for sleek, responsive design).
  • Database: MySQL (to store transaction records and budget information).

Learning Opportunities:

  • Creating interactive charts and graphs (e.g., with Chart.js).
  • Implementing data validation and security for sensitive financial data.
  • Developing a user-friendly dashboard with real-time updates.

Real time messaging application

A web application that allows users to send messages to each other in real time. Users can create accounts, send messages to each other and view messages in real time.

Technologies to Use:

  • Backend: Node.js and Express.js (for handling user authentication, real-time messaging, and chatroom management).
  • Frontend: Tailwind CSS (for sleek, responsive, and modern UI design).
  • Database: MongoDB (to store user profiles, chatroom details, and message logs).

Learning Opportunities:

  • Building real-time messaging functionality using Socket.IO.
  • Implementing user authentication and session management with JWT and cookies.
  • Designing a scalable and efficient database schema for managing user data and chat histories.
  • Developing features like typing indicators, message read statuses, and user presence tracking.
  • Exploring file-sharing capabilities within chatrooms (e.g., images, documents).

Career Pathway Timeline

  • High School

    • Participate in programming contests and hackathons.
    • Work on personal projects like the DJ event planner and portfolio website.

  • Post-Secondary Education

    • Enroll in a Bachelor’s program in Computer Science or Software Engineering at UofT or Waterloo.
    • Complete co-op placements or internships to gain hands-on industry experience.
    • Build advanced projects, explore AI, and develop full-stack skills.

  • Early Career

    • Start working as a junior web developer or software engineer.
    • Contribute to impactful projects in industries like education or healthcare.
    • Attend hackathons, industry events, and join online developer communities.
    • Build a strong portfolio and develop expertise in frameworks like React, Node.js, and Laravel.

  • Mid-Career

    • Transition to a full-stack web developer role.
    • Take on leadership roles or contribute to open-source initiatives.
    • Expand skills in areas like database management, real-time systems, or AI.
    • Explore opportunities in entrepreneurship or innovative tech companies.

  • Long-Term Aspirations

    • Work on large-scale, impactful projects that improve lives and empower communities.
    • Potentially pursue a master’s degree in AI, data science, or human-computer interaction.
    • Remain a lifelong learner by staying updated with the latest trends and technologies.

Career Insights and Goals

From my research and experiences, I’ve learned that a career in web development requires a blend of technical expertise, creativity, and adaptability. The tech industry evolves rapidly, so staying ahead involves continuous learning through certifications, online courses, and practical experience. I also recognize the importance of building a strong professional network, which I plan to achieve by attending hackathons, industry events, and joining online developer communities.

My ultimate career goal in computer science is to become a full-stack web developer, creating applications that address real-world challenges. In the long term, I aspire to work on projects that make a difference in fields like education, healthcare, or community development. By combining technical proficiency with an understanding of user needs, I aim to create impactful, innovative, and user-centric solutions.

Whether through entrepreneurship, working with a forward-thinking tech company, or contributing to open-source initiatives, my vision is to be a lifelong learner and a proactive problem-solver in the ever-evolving field of technology. By consistently setting and achieving incremental goals, I am confident in my ability to reach my ultimate aspiration of contributing to meaningful projects that improve lives and empower communities.

Conclusion

My future plan with computer science is not completely what I want to pursue as I don't have a crazy passion to do this for the rest of my life. Computer science, to me, is still a fun and interesting field that allows me to explore creative problem-solving and build innovative solutions. I also might want to pursue Artificial intelligence in computer science instead of web development. While I may not see myself dedicating my entire career to it, I value the skills and experiences it provides, which can be applied to a wide range of industries and roles.

For now, I aim to gain as much knowledge and experience as possible in computer science, as it offers a strong foundation and opens doors to many exciting opportunities. While I may not see myself working exclusively in this field forever, I’m confident that the skills I acquire will help me make meaningful contributions, no matter where my career ultimately takes me.
